channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: The White House paused rules to curb steel plant pollution. Locals weigh in
item.description: In parts of Western Pennsylvania, steel plants are big employers – and big polluters. This summer, the Trump administration paused regulations that would have forced steel mills to curb air pollution.

item.title: Zelenskyy touted Ukraine's ingenuity against Russia in UN address
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy addresses the U.N. General Assembly, as diplomats struggle to stop Russia's aggression.

item.title: Warming waters are shifting the diversity of American river fish
item.description: A pair of studies show that American rivers are getting hotter, posing a risk for many fish species.

item.title: California is seeing a spike in cases of Valley Fever
item.description: California is seeing a spike in cases valley fever — an illness spread by fungal spores. Researchers speculate the rise is tied to patterns of drought and precipitation.

item.title: Deadly shooting at Dallas ICE detention facility may have been politically motivated
item.description: NPR's Sergio Martinez-Beltran has the latest update from Dallas, where four people were shot at an ICE detention facility Wednesday morning.

item.title: MLB will allow players to challenge balls and strikes starting in 2026
item.description: With a tap of their head, players will be able to trigger an automated review when they disagree with an umpire's call. In spring training this year, just over half of challenges were successful.

item.title: A year after Hurricane Helene, communities still wait for federal reimbursements
item.description: A year after Hurricane Helene devastated parts of Western North Carolina, communities are eager for FEMA funds to reimburse recovery expenses, but it's not clear when and if that money will come.

item.title: Elon Musk's company wants to build tunnels to alleviate Houston's floodwater problems
item.description: One idea to prevent another hurricane catastrophe in Houston is massive underground tunnels to redirect storm water. New reporting reveals Elon Musk's Boring Company has been involved in the planning.

item.title: Remembering Italian actress Claudia Cardinale
item.description: The Italian actress Claudia Cardinale has died at the age of 87. She was known for roles in major international and American films of the 1960s and 70s like 8 1/2 and The Pink Panther.

item.title: Amanda Shires new album 'Nobody's Girl' tells her side of public breakup
item.description: Amanda Shires new album, Nobody's Girl, explores the very public breakup with her husband, fellow musician Jason Isbell.
